problem_text:
17.94. (Well-known problem). Can the free product Z ∗G of the infinite cyclic group
Z and a nontrivial group G be the normal closure of a single element?
Editors’ comments: the negation is also known as Kervaire’s conjecture. It was
proved for torsion-free groups (A. Klyachko, Commun.
Algebra, 21, no. 7 (1993),
2555–2575) and for residually finite groups (M. Gerstenhaber, O. S. Rothaus, Proc.
Nat. Acad. Sci. U.S.A., 48 (1962) 1531–1533).
J. Mycielski
